dictionary.title: abiotic
dictionary.desc: Terms scraped from Wikipedia and elsewhere. Peter Murray-Rust,2019

entry.name: ‎abiotic component‎
entry.description: non-living chemical and physical part of the environment that affect living organisms and the functioning of ecosystems

entry.name: ‎climate‎
entry.description: statistics of temperature, humidity, atmospheric pressure, wind, precipitation, atmospheric particle count and other meteorological elemental measurements in a given region over long periods

entry.name: ‎drought‎
entry.description: extended period when a region notes a deficiency in its water supply

entry.name: ‎negative regulation of endoplasmic reticulum stress-induced intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway‎
entry.description: Any process that stops, prevents or reduces the frequency, rate or extent of an endoplasmic reticulum stress-induced intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway.

entry.name: ‎flood‎
entry.description: overflow of water that submerges land

entry.name: ‎global warming‎
entry.description: rise in the average temperature of Earth's atmosphere and oceans since the late 19th century and its projected continuation

entry.name: ‎stress response to metal ion‎
entry.description: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell or an organism (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a disturbance in organismal or cellular homeostasis caused by a metal ion st

entry.name: ‎natural disaster‎
entry.description: major adverse event resulting from natural processes of the Earth

entry.name: ‎negative regulation of intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway in response to osmotic stress‎
entry.description: Any process that stops, prevents or reduces the frequency, rate or extent of intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway in response to osmotic stress.

entry.name: ‎phosphate‎
entry.description: salt or ester of phosphoric acid

entry.name: ‎precipitation‎
entry.description: product of the condensation of atmospheric water vapour that falls under gravity

entry.name: ‎salinity‎
entry.description: saltiness or amount of salt dissolved in a body of water

entry.name: ‎stress‎
entry.description: organism's response to a stressor such as an environmental condition or a stimulus

entry.name: ‎tornado‎
entry.description: violently rotating column of air that is in contact with both the earth's surface and a cumulonimbus cloud in the air

entry.name: ‎wildfire‎
entry.description: uncontrolled fire in an area of combustible vegetation that occurs in the countryside or a wilderness area
